title: What to do when the jungler doesn't gank?
body: Sometimes I need a gank real badly (either because of a bad matchup or a bad choice that the enemy took advantage of really well, or just bad luck), and no one does anything, how do I deal with these kinds of situations?

replies.body:
Sit back, play safe and farm or go gank another lane and "make plays" elsewhere.

Make a teammate stronger to make up for your potential uselessness LOL

Junglers aim their ganks with two main elements:
-opportunity
-impact

Opportunity means they will not gank if you're pushing, or if you're clearly low on health and unable to fight. Just keep the reality in, a gank is great when it's a 2v1 fight, but not when it's a towerdive or a 1v1 fight.
Impact means they will not gank if there is too little to gain from it. If you're way behind or the enemy is fed, then the gank is purely a containment attempt. If the enemy is awful (or complains about getting camped), a gank is a lot more likely, as the guy looks like an easy kill and possibly a tower, which would help you and your team a lot.

Basically, if you can't (one would expect "win your lane", but that's overshooting) face your opponent somehow decently, a gank won't help you, and won't arrive.

I'd suggest to either sit back under tower and farm, or SWAP your lane with someone more suited for that matchup before it is too late.
